content.webTitle: Trump insults London mayor after attack | The minute

fields.headline: Trump insults London mayor after attack
fields.bodyText: Donald Trump accused Sadiq Khan of making a “pathetic excuse” for his advice to fellow Londoners not to be alarmed about an increased police presence in the city. Khan’s office said Trump had taken Khan’s original remarks out of context. Guardian view: rescind Trump’s invite In a Twitter tirade, Trump said “The Justice Dept. should have stayed with the original Travel Ban, not the watered down, politically correct version”. Justice department lawyers defending the ban had been arguing that it was not a “travel ban”. Ceci n’est pas … wait, yes it is If you think you may have experienced extreme vetting, we would like to hear from you, particularly if you are Muslim or were traveling from a Muslim country. Let us know It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please make a contribution. Thanks for reading! Make a contribution today Former FBI director James Comey will be asked at a sworn hearing Thursday to discuss links between Trump associates and Russia that “I don’t think... have been fully revealed”, said the committee’s ranking Democrat. Read our coverage Deputy spokeswoman Sarah Huckabee Sanders stood in for press secretary Sean Spicer at Monday’s White House briefing. Asked to explain, she said Spicer was “at the White House and he’s taking on a little bit of extra duty”.
